quiz.title: Applications of Graphs
quiz.subtitle: Unit 4 Quiz 8: Real-World Applications of Linear Graphs
quiz.subject: Mathematics

questions.question: A graph shows distance (miles) vs. time (hours). What does the slope represent?
questions.explanation: Slope = $\frac{\Delta \text{distance}}{\Delta \text{time}}$ = speed in miles per hour.

questions.question: In a cost vs. items graph for a bakery, what does the y-intercept represent?
questions.explanation: y-intercept = cost when 0 items are made = fixed costs that exist even with no production.

questions.question: The graph shows a car's fuel level over time. What does a horizontal segment indicate?
options: Car is stopped with engine off
Car is driving at constant speed
questions.explanation: Horizontal = no change in fuel over time = car not running (fuel not being used).

questions.question: A phone plan charges $\$20$ monthly fee plus $\$0.10$ per MB. What is the slope in a cost vs. usage graph?
questions.explanation: Slope = rate per MB = $\$0.10$ per MB. The $\$20$ is the y-intercept (fixed monthly fee).

questions.question: In a temperature vs. time graph for a refrigerator, what does a negative slope indicate?
questions.explanation: Negative slope = temperature drops as time passes = cooling.

questions.question: The graph shows profits over months. What does the x-intercept represent?
A taxi charges $\$3.50$ drop fee plus $\$2.25$ per mile. What is the equation for cost (C) vs. miles (m)?
questions.explanation: Slope = rate per mile = $\$2.25$, y-intercept = initial fee = $\$3.50$.

questions.question: What does a steeper slope indicate in a savings account balance vs. time graph?
questions.explanation: Steeper slope = balance increases faster per month = higher deposit or contribution rate.

questions.question: A graph shows coffee cooling. What would a curve (not straight line) indicate?
options: Cooling rate is constant over time
questions.explanation: Curve = changing slope = cooling rate isn't constant (cools faster when hotter, slower when closer to room temp).

questions.question: In a revenue vs. advertising spend graph, what does a positive slope of 3 mean?
questions.explanation: Slope = $\frac{\Delta \text{revenue}}{\Delta \text{ad spend}}$ = 3 means $\$1$ ad spend â†’ $\$3$ revenue increase.

scoreMessages.90: Exceptional application skills! You can interpret graphs in diverse real-world contexts and extract meaningful insights.
scoreMessages.70: Strong practical understanding! Review connecting graphical features to their real-world meanings.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice: 1) What slope represents in each context, 2) Meaning of intercepts, 3) Linear vs nonlinear in applications.
scoreMessages.0: Start with simple contexts: distance-time = speed, cost-items = price per item. Practice identifying what quantities are on each axis.
